Entries.default: "Hold it right there, lovesome! If you ain't one of Benweth's own, you know you can't be back here."
"Benweth? You mean the captain of the Drake?"
"Aye. And it shouldn't surprise you. Aeldys set sail two nights ago. Means Benweth's running the Deadlight tiptop in her stead."
"What he says goes. And what he likes, he gets to do. Including the right to lock down parts of the fortress."
She licks the flat of her thumb. Then she rubs it over the etched silver of her gun barrel, spit-shining the metal - to draw attention to the muzzle pointed at your face.
"If you're thinking to get mutinous, don't. You know they call him Brutal Ben for a reason. He ain't shy about tossing mutineers into the stocks for the crows to pick off their skin."
[Attack] "What Benweth doesn't know won't hurt him. But it will get you killed."
"Bloody pox-piss! You mutinous louts get bolder and bolder, don't you?!" She cracks her gun at you.
"Bit of lead in your belly ought to settle you right down."
[Back away with your hands up.] "You're right, I do know."
"Then you also know I'll be showing you out. This way - follow me and keep those hands where I can see them."
"Now, lovesome. I know you know that Benweth can't know how you've come up here. Twice now."
"You don't want to be speared like a shark, you'd best be backing down nice and slow."

"Enough's enough, lovesome, and you know it. I'm going to show you the color of your insides."

Rather than draw on you, she fumbles a large metal horn from the sling holster crossing her hips. Then she lifts it to her svef-stained mouth.
"Right soon as I sound this horn - so every last tar in Deadlight knows there's blood in the water."
"Once you're netted, Ben'll make you play Dead Man's Nag. Give us a laugh before your gullet's slit."
"Any friend of Ben's is a true pal of mine."
